node.title: Anti-vax Asofa-Solomona to reportedly leave NRL for Japanese rugby switch
node.description: The 25-year-old is unable to return to Melbourne Storm until he is vaccinated.
node.content: ["New Zealand Kiwis and Melbourne Storm prop Nelson Asofa-Solomona will reportedly walk away from the NRL and switch to Japanese rugby in 2023.", "According to Fox Sports, 25-year-old Asofa-Solomona will leave the NRL at the end of this year, and link up with Panasonic Wild Knights, run by former Wallabies and Crusaders coach Robbie Deans.", "The move would come as Asofa-Solomona battles Victorian state legislation, unable to return to Melbourne Storm over his refusal to be vaccinated against COVID-19.", "Despite the NRL's refusal to mandate COVID-19 vaccination, players in the states of Victoria and Queensland must receive two or more doses in order to train and play.", "Asofa-Solomona was the only Melbourne Storm player to resist being vaccinated, and missed the December deadline to return to his club for pre-season late last year.", "Melbourne Storm captain and New Zealand teammate Jesse Bromwich' attempts to contact Asofa-Solomona proved futile, with his calls to the hesitant star avoided.", "Asofa-Solomona isn't the first NRL star to risk his job by avoiding the COVID-19 vaccine either.\u00a0", "Canterbury Bulldogs forward John Asiata was released last month over his stance, while North Queensland Cowboys and Tonga star Jason Taumalolo has reportedly been served a written warning by his club for his refusal.", "At present there is no active vaccine mandate in the Japanese Rugby League One, giving the likes of Asofa-Solomona a potential destination to continue their career while continuing to avoid being jabbed.", "Asofa-Solomona has won two NRL premierships with Melbourne Storm, and played six tests for the Kiwis."]
